snippet: Governors and others from North Carolina to Maine are using Twitter, Facebook and YouTube to reach constituents unable to watch television.
abstract: Public officials and government agencies throughout Northeast have embraced social media during aftermath of Hurricane Sandy; using tools like text messaging, Twitter, Facebook and Youtube, officials can communicate critical information to members of the public who may be unable to watch television.

byline.original: By BRIAN STELTER and JENNIFER PRESTON

lead_paragraph: Governors and others from North Carolina to Maine are using Twitter, Facebook and YouTube to reach constituents unable to watch television.

headline.main: In Crisis, Public Officials Embrace Social Media
headline.print_headline: In Crisis, Public Officials Embrace Social Media
